capsules_submitted.utterance: So I was reading about Snape's family history and it turns out he has a pretty complex lineage. His mother, Eileen Prince, was a Muggle, which is really interesting because it shows how his wizarding heritage came to be. And then there's his father, Tobias Snape, who was a half-blood wizard - that's what makes him a mixed-wizard, I suppose. It's all pretty fascinating stuff.

You know, I've always been fascinated by the complexities of the wizarding world. The fact that Snape's lineage is a mix of both pure-blood and Muggle heritage really adds to his intriguing character. It makes me wonder how that would have affected his experiences growing up at Hogwarts. I think it's interesting that he was able to navigate both worlds, but still maintain a strong sense of loyalty to those he cared about.
